requirement_tested: Implement a discussion forum feature allowing anonymous posting
user_persona: A first-year student looking to share thoughts without revealing identity.
user_goal: To anonymously post a question about course materials in the correct topic category.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to New Post Creation
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the campus discussion board homepage and wants to start a new thread. He sees a prominent 'New Post' button.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'New Post' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form appears with fields for title, content, and a dropdown menu for selecting a topic.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Out Anonymous Post Details
narrative_steps.description: Alex fills in his question as the post title and elaborates in the content area. He selects 'Academics' from the topic dropdown since it relates to coursework.
narrative_steps.action: Fill out the title and content fields, then select 'Academics' from the topic dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form fields accept input correctly and the selected topic updates visually.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting the Anonymous Post
narrative_steps.description: Confident that everything is filled out properly, Alex submits the post using the dark olive green submit button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Post is successfully created via the /api/posts endpoint and the form clears, ready for another submission.

requirement_tested: Enable users to reply to existing posts anonymously
user_persona: A senior student wanting to help peers by answering questions.
user_goal: To provide an answer to someone else's question while remaining anonymous.

narrative_steps.title: Finding a Relevant Post
narrative_steps.description: Taylor browses the latest posts and finds one asking about exam preparation strategies.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the post detail page by clicking on the post title.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The post content loads along with a section below for replies.

narrative_steps.title: Composing an Anonymous Reply
narrative_steps.description: Taylor types her advice into the reply text area located beneath the original post.
narrative_steps.action: Enter reply content into the text area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Text area accepts input normally without prompting for personal information.

narrative_steps.title: Sending the Anonymous Response
narrative_steps.description: After proofreading, Taylor clicks the dark olive green submit button to send her reply.
narrative_steps.action: Click the reply submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Reply is posted successfully via the /api/replies endpoint and immediately visible under the original post.

requirement_tested: Provide functionality for browsing and searching posts
user_persona: A curious student exploring various topics discussed on campus.
user_goal: To discover interesting discussions either through browsing or searching keywords.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Paginated Posts
narrative_steps.description: Jordan scrolls down the main feed to see more posts, noticing new ones loading as he reaches the bottom.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the end of the current post list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional posts are fetched dynamically using pagination and appended to the list.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Specific Content
narrative_steps.description: Wanting to find something specific, Jordan uses the search bar at the top to look up 'final exams'.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'final exams' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Search results for 'final exams' are returned from the /api/search endpoint and displayed.

requirement_tested: Allow users to follow topics of interest
user_persona: An engaged student passionate about campus events.
user_goal: To keep updated on all discussions happening within the Events topic.

narrative_steps.title: Discovering Topic Tags
narrative_steps.description: While browsing posts, Riley notices several tagged with 'Events' and decides to follow this topic.
narrative_steps.action: Locate a post tagged with 'Events' and click the adjacent 'Follow' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: UI toggles to show 'Unfollow' state instantly, confirming subscription change locally.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Follow Action
narrative_steps.description: Riley continues browsing, confident that future activity in the 'Events' topic will notify him.
narrative_steps.action: No further action taken.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: POST request was made silently to /api/topics/{id}/follow to record the preference server-side.

requirement_tested: Implement a notification system for followed topics
user_persona: A busy student relying on notifications to stay informed.
user_goal: To get notified whenever there's new activity in followed topics like Career Opportunities.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Real-Time Notifications
narrative_steps.description: Morgan has already followed 'Career Opportunities'. Suddenly, a new reply appears in a related thread.
narrative_steps.action: Wait passively for real-time event.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: WebSocket delivers a notification automatically which shows up in Morganâ€™s notification panel.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Notification Panel
narrative_steps.description: Noticing the alert icon changed color, Morgan opens the notification panel to check what happened.
narrative_steps.action: Click the notification bell icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dropdown panel reveals unread alerts including the new reply; PATCH call marks them as read.

requirement_tested: Ensure user privacy by not collecting personal information
user_persona: A cautious student concerned about online privacy.
user_goal: To participate freely without worrying about being tracked or identified.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying No Tracking Scripts
narrative_steps.description: Casey inspects the page source and browser developer tools to confirm no trackers are running.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser DevTools > Network tab and refresh the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only internal API calls are observed, with no third-party analytics domains contacted.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Footer for Privacy Link
narrative_steps.description: Curious about the privacy policy, Casey scrolls to the footer and clicks the provided link.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to bottom of page and click 'Privacy Policy'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Link navigates to /privacy-policy where details about anonymity practices are explained.

requirement_tested: Secure the platform against unauthorized access and data breaches
user_persona: A security-conscious student aware of common web threats.
user_goal: To interact safely knowing the platform protects against malicious actors.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Site Without Authentication Prompt
narrative_steps.description: Dana opens the platform and begins browsing without ever being asked to log in or register.
narrative_steps.action: Visit multiple public pages without logging in.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Pages load normally without redirection to authentication flows.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Rate Limit Enforcement
narrative_steps.description: Dana tries rapidly submitting many posts to test whether the system resists abuse.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to submit multiple posts quickly in succession.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Requests begin failing temporarily due to rate limiting enforced behind the scenes.

requirement_tested: Design the UI with honeydew as the background color
user_persona: A design-aware student appreciating clean aesthetics.
user_goal: To enjoy a visually consistent experience with soft background tones.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Background Color Consistency
narrative_steps.description: Jamie navigates across different sections of the site noting how the background remains uniformly styled.
narrative_steps.action: Visit homepage, individual post pages, and settings screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Every page utilizes honeydew (#F0FFF0) as the background color consistently.

requirement_tested: Use dark olive green for component colors throughout the interface
user_persona: A visual learner who relies on clear UI cues.
user_goal: To recognize interactive elements easily thanks to cohesive styling.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Interactive Components
narrative_steps.description: Pat looks around the interface spotting buttons, forms, and links highlighted in a matching accent hue.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect various UI components such as buttons, form inputs, and navigation links.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All primary interactive elements use dark olive green (#556B2F) as their accent color.

requirement_tested: Create a frontend that fetches all data via backend APIs
user_persona: A tech-savvy student interested in how applications work under the hood.
user_goal: To observe seamless integration between frontend presentation and backend data delivery.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Initial Data Asynchronously
narrative_steps.description: Quinn opens the homepage and watches content populate gradually rather than appearing empty initially.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage and monitor network activity.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend waits for GET requests to /api/posts and similar endpoints before rendering content.

requirement_tested: Develop a backend connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A computer science student learning backend systems.
user_goal: To understand how backend connects securely to its data store.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Database Connection Setup
narrative_steps.description: Riley reviews deployment configuration ensuring proper database connectivity using standard variables.
narrative_steps.action: Check backend logs or configuration files for presence of DB_* environment variables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Database connection initialized using localhost, port 5432, myappuser, myapppassword, and myapp values.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with 'install:all' script for frontend and backend installation
user_persona: A junior developer setting up a project for the first time.
user_goal: To simplify setup process by installing dependencies for both sides together.

narrative_steps.title: Running Unified Install Command
narrative_steps.description: Sam clones the repository and runs the unified install command to prepare the environment.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run install:all' from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend node_modules folders are populated with necessary packages.

requirement_tested: Set up 'dev' script in package.json to run frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A collaborative developer working alongside teammates.
user_goal: To launch full stack development environment efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers Together
narrative_steps.description: Jordan prepares to code by starting both frontend and backend servers simultaneously.
narrative_steps.action: Execute 'npm run dev' from root folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently launches both frontend and backend watch processes allowing integrated debugging.

requirement_tested: Support real-time updates for new replies and notifications
user_persona: A responsive participant expecting timely feedback.
user_goal: To receive instant updates when others engage with followed content.

narrative_steps.title: Establishing WebSocket Connection
narrative_steps.description: Alex loads the app and observes a background connection being established for live messaging.
narrative_steps.action: Open the application and inspect network tab for WebSocket handshake.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: WebSocket connection initiates successfully to ws://localhost:PORT/ws/notifications.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Instant Updates
narrative_steps.description: Without refreshing, Alex receives immediate notice when someone replies to a followed post.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for real-time message arrival.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Live message arrives through WebSocket and displays automatically in notification dropdown.

requirement_tested: Include moderation tools for managing inappropriate content
user_persona: A responsible admin tasked with maintaining community standards.
user_goal: To identify and act upon reported problematic content swiftly.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Moderation Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: As an administrator, Taylor logs into the hidden moderation panel to review flagged items.
narrative_steps.action: Manually navigate to /admin/moderate and authenticate manually.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard loads showing unresolved reports sorted by severity levels.

narrative_steps.title: Taking Moderation Actions
narrative_steps.description: Seeing an offensive reply, Taylor chooses to remove it permanently from the platform.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Delete' button next to the flagged item.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: DELETE request removes the entry from database and updates the dashboard view accordingly.
